```fsharp
type RecA =

      B : int
      /// Yo
      C : int
      D : int
      E : int
      F : int
      G : int
      H : int }

    { A : int
      B : int
      // Yo
      C : int
      D : int
      E : int
      F : int
      G : int
      H : int }

    { A : int
      B : int
      C : int
      D : int
      E : int
      F : int
      G : int
      H : int }
```
            

#### Result

```fsharp
type RecA =
    {
        A: int
        B: int
        /// Yo
        C: int
        D: int
        E: int
        F: int
        G: int
        H: int
    }

type RecB =
    { A: int
      B: int
      // Yo
      C: int
      D: int
      E: int
      F: int
      G: int
      H: int }


type RecC =
    { A: int
      B: int
      C: int
      D: int
      E: int
      F: int
      G: int
      H: int }

```
            
#### Problem description

Take note the difference between `RecA` and both `RecB` and `RecC`. `RecA`'s whitespace and closing bracket changes while it the original shape is retained in `RecB` and `RecC`. Also, records will change their entire shape as soon as you add a doc comment--this isn't expected and creates unnecessary noise in git diffs.

#### Extra information

- [ ] The formatted result breaks my code.
- [ ] The formatted result gives compiler warnings.
- [ ] I or my company would be willing to help fix this.

# Compatibility Report
- Name of the game with compatibility issues: Halo Infinite

Note:

Creating a preliminary post regarding this due to the initial Technical Preview Flight being released today. labels.name: Game compatibility - Unofficial
labels.description: Games not expected to work without issues

issue.body:
# Compatibility Report
- Name of the game with compatibility issues: Halo Infinite
- Steam AppID of the game: 1240440 (Believed to be this ID)

Note:

Creating a preliminary post regarding this due to the initial Technical Preview Flight being released today. It is unknown by what source the assets will be available to download on, but the feedback from other users on Proton regarding Linux issues would be applicable to view here in preparation for the Steam Release this holiday season.
